replies.body: would also like a definition of landmark
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Orange_(South_Australia)
{{champion:41}} Please do it

Landmark is an object or feature of a landscape or town that is easily seen and recognized from a distance, especially one that enables someone to establish their location.

So anything seen in your pic that clearly lets us establish you are in Oceania =D

Also for those that may not be near one, get a group of your buddies together, play some games and take a pic! that works too
what if i don't have any "buddies"?
Join a local community or just head out to a local landmark and snap a selfie =D
the problem with oceania is that landmarks are generally in cities and lots of people live in the middle of nowhere lol
picture of friends playing together works too!

but is it an equal chance, or just will land marks get a higher chance of wining then disadvantaged players (i say disadvantaged knowing that rito has no obligation to give out free stuff and so they can do what they want, just asking the questions here)

Winners will be picked based on creativity and OCE flavour.

Some would say being able to create an awesome selfie even with limited resources is a great sign of creativity
would being a character and playing on a potato laptop be creative?
creative group photos will definitely have a chance!
take photos at local attractions, every country town has a least one.
We're going with the massive octopus thing in our town, no clue if it's "landmarky" enough but she'll be right, just in it for them keys

{{champion:238}} plz do it

Define "landmark".

I have an idea, but I'm not too sure it would be accepted.
I'd assume they mean things like Eureka Skydeck, Shrine of remembrance or any other locations that would be considered ''Tourist Attractions''.
basically its things that can establish that you are somewhere significant in OCE, like Lunar Park or the Sydney Opera House

Well, it's been over a day with no response, so Riot can just accept my submission.

Besides, I don't have time to travel over 2 hours just to participate in this (yes, I live out in the middle of nowhere).
is movie world (theme parks in general) considered landmarks?
